entry.title: Learning iPad Programming LiveLessons Available for Purchase
entry.content: I learned today that the Learning iPad Programming LiveLessons videos are available for purchase from the InformIT web site. So you don’t need a Safari Books Online account to purchase and enjoy these training videos.

entry.title: Learning iPad Programming LiveLessons
entry.content:
I should mention not all topics found in the book are covered in the LiveLessons. There simply wasn’t enough time to cover everything. Besides, covering everything may have resulted in 20 hours of videos instead of the 8 and half hours available today. Still, if you are new to iPad programming, and you are looking for an alternative way to learn iPad programming then check out Learning iPad Programming LiveLessons.

Attention iPad users with a Safari Books Online account: You can watch the Learning iPad Programming LiveLessons from your iPad using the Safari To Go iPad app.

entry.title: Tips for Writing a Universal App
entry.content: Here’s another video that was recorded earlier this year. In this video I share some tips for writing a universal app. Unfortunately the chapter on writing a universal app was dropped from the book. There just wasn’t enough room after writing nearly 800 pages. So this short video will have to do for now.

entry.title: Accessing the Photo Library
entry.content: Here is another brief video I did earlier this year for InformIT. This one is on accessing the photo library from within your iOS application.

entry.title: Author Intro Video
entry.content:
InformIT asked me to record a few video podcasts about our book Learning iPad Programming. A lot has changed since the videos were recorded. Tom has come on as a co-author, and the book was updated to focus on iOS 5. But the videos still give a good sense of what you will learn while reading the book.

That said, here is the first video. I will post another video in a few days.
